## `geom_path()`

:::: {.panel-tabset}

### Basic use

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**BASICS:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: basic_path
#| eval: true
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
ggp2_path_base <- ggplot(data = economics) + 
    geom_path(mapping = aes(x = date, y = unemploy))
ggp2_path_base
```
:::

### Additional Arguments

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**ARGUMENTS:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Below the graphs are built with `geom_path()`'s `lineend` argument set to `"butt"` and the three possible options for `linejoin` (`"bevel"`, `"round"`, and `"mitre"`). The `size` and `linemitre` have been increased to exaggerate their effects. 
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: args_1_path
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| layout-ncol: 2
ggp2_path_bb <- ggplot(data = economics,
    mapping = aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) +
    geom_path(
        size = 5,
        lineend = "butt",
        linejoin = "bevel",
        linemitre = 3) + 
    labs(title = "butt/bevel")
ggp2_path_bb
ggp2_path_br <- ggplot(data = economics,
    mapping = aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) +
    geom_path(size = 5,
        lineend = "butt",
        linejoin = "round",
        linemitre = 3) + 
    labs(title = "butt/round")
ggp2_path_br
ggp2_path_bm <- ggplot(data = economics,
    mapping = aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) +
    geom_path(
        size = 5,
        lineend = "butt",
        linejoin = "mitre",
        linemitre = 3
    ) + 
    labs(title = "butt/mitre")
ggp2_path_bm
```
:::
